title: Explicit Science Process Skills Instruction for Developing Preservice Science Teachers' Scientific Reasoning Abilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary science curriculum content and basic science teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning as the primary environment, emphasizing scientific reasoning training using mathematical concepts

learning_goals: Preservice science teachers improve their ability to control variables and engage in hypothetico-deductive reasoning by over 30%.

Learners apply three or more variable control strategies and include hypothesis-deductive reasoning steps when designing a single-session biology lesson plan for elementary/middle school using scientific reasoning sub-elements (variable control, hypothesis-deductive reasoning).

Learners diagnose learning gaps in science thinking (conservation of matter, volume, proportionality, probabilistic reasoning) with â‰¥80% accuracy using diagnostic tools for elementary/middle school students and design three or more personalized improvement strategies (e.g., concept visualization activities, real-life case applications, error analysis worksheets) for implementation within four weeks.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
